alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu; Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 18 at 2:00PM CST until December 18 at 2:30PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN CAMERON AND SOUTHWESTERN CALCASIEU PARISHES... At 159 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Grand Lake to 7 miles southwest of Johnsons Bayou, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cameron, Vinton, Grand Lake, Johnsons Bayou, Sabine National Wildlife, Hackberry, Holly Beach, Toomey, Carlyss and Constance Beach. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
